Created attachment 545645
3 files demonstrating the problem

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110622232052

Steps to reproduce:

Tested on:
- User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0

- firefox-8.0a1.en-US.linux-i686 (Nightly, retrieved on 13 Jul 2011)
- Firefox (Windows Vista, friend's computer, do not know the version)

The zip archive contains 3 files that demonstrates the problem.

1) Open "test.html", which links to a CSS file "test.css". The page consist of a single link with both CSS animation (slides-in on load) and CSS transition (changes color on hover). Click "Reload" to re-trigger the CSS animation if you missed it. It should run smoothly.
2) Click the link, which leads to "test1.html". This is an empty page.
3) Click the back button to return to "test.html".
4) Click "Reload" to re-trigger the CSS animation. The sliding motion will now stutter.


Actual results:

The first time "test.html" is visited, the CSS animation runs smoothly, without any interference from the CSS transition.

The second time "test.html" is visited the CSS animation stutters. It appears that the CSS transition is first being applied to the slide-in motion, after which the CSS animation applies. This only occurs if the link in "test.html" is a visited link.

Clearing the history will restore the correct CSS animation behaviour.


Expected results:

The CSS animation should runs smoothly on both occasion.

May be related to bug 666464.
